headline: 'We Would Likely See A Significant Contraction,' SoFi CEO Anthony Noto Says Of Trump's 10% Cap Plan — Consumers 'Will Still Need Access To Credit'
summary: A policy meant to make borrowing cheaper could end up changing who gets access to credit at all. That is the likely outcome of a proposed 10% cap on credit card interest rates, according to SoFi Technologies (NASDAQ:SOFI) CEO Anthony Noto. In a recent post on X, Noto responded to President Donald Trump's proposal, saying the immediate effect would likely be a contraction in credit card lending rather than a drop in consumer demand for borrowing. headline: Trump's proposed credit card rate cap: Sheila Bair weighs in
summary: President Trump called on Congress to implement a 10% cap on credit card interest rates. JPMorgan (JPM) CEO Jamie Dimon said this would create an "economic disaster." Sheila Bair, former chair of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC), sits down with Market Domination Overtime host Josh Lipton to discuss the proposal and banks' reactions. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: 'Garbage Loans'; What A Prudent Investor Should Know
Trump's JPMorgan lawsuit underscores his growing clash with Wall Street
summary: NEW YORK/WASHINGTON, Jan 25 (Reuters) - U. President Donald Trump's lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase and its CEO Jamie Dimon highlights a growing, and politically fraught, conflict in the administration's policy agenda for Wall Street, with big banks scoring wins but also facing setbacks.

headline: Limbo for Longer: Don’t Expect More Fed Rate Cuts Before Mid-2026
summary: 2026 presents a catch-22 for the Fed. It normally cuts rates to buoy hiring, which tightened last year, but that could drive up inflation.

headline: JPMorgan’s (JPM) 2026 Net Interest Income Growth Remained a Key Focus at Truist
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE:JPM) ranks among the best financial stocks to buy according to billionaire Israel Englander. headline: Cathie Wood Is Buying Joby—JPMorgan Calls It A Top Short
summary: Cathie Wood is doubling down on flying taxis. JPMorgan is betting against them. In a new thematic research report, JPMorgan Chase & Co (NYSE:JPM) named Joby Aviation Inc (NYSE:JOBY) one of its top short ideas, arguing the stock trades at an aggressive premium despite a long road to certification, commercialization, and profitability.
